intro: Lithocardium poliophylla, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
